Package graph

Class Topic

  • java.lang.Object
    • graph.Topic
  • public class Topic
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a communication channel in the publish-subscribe pattern for the computational graph system.

    A Topic acts as a message broker between agents, allowing publishers to send messages and subscribers to receive them. Topics maintain lists of both publishers and subscribers, and store the last published message for retrieval.

    Publish-Subscribe Pattern

    The Topic class implements the core publish-subscribe messaging pattern:
    • Publishers - Agents that send messages to the topic
    • Subscribers - Agents that receive messages from the topic
    • Message Routing - When a message is published, all subscribers are notified

    Thread Safety

    This class is designed for concurrent access:
    • Uses CopyOnWriteArrayList for subscriber and publisher lists
    • Volatile lastMessage field ensures visibility across threads
    • Safe for multiple threads to publish and subscribe simultaneously

    Message Flow Example

    
 // Create a topic
 Topic temperatureTopic = new Topic("temperature");
 
 // Register agents
 temperatureTopic.addPublisher(sensorAgent);
 temperatureTopic.subscribe(displayAgent);
 temperatureTopic.subscribe(alertAgent);
 
 // When sensor publishes a message
 Message tempReading = new Message("25.5", 25.5);
 temperatureTopic.publish(tempReading);
 // Both displayAgent and alertAgent receive the message via callback

    Concurrent Access Patterns

    The CopyOnWriteArrayList ensures that:
    • Iteration over subscribers during publish() is safe even if the list is modified
    • Adding/removing subscribers doesn't block message publishing
    • Multiple threads can safely modify subscriber/publisher lists
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    Agent, Message, TopicManagerSingleton

    • Field Detail

      • name

        public final java.lang.String name

    • Method Detail

      • subscribe

        public void subscribe​(Agent a)
        Registers an agent as a subscriber to this topic.

        Once subscribed, the agent will receive all messages published to this topic via its Agent.callback(String, Message) method. If the agent is already subscribed, this method has no effect (no duplicate subscriptions).

        Thread Safety: This method is safe to call concurrently with other subscription operations and message publishing.

        Parameters:
        a - the agent to subscribe to this topic
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the agent is null
        See Also:
        unsubscribe(Agent), publish(Message), Agent.callback(String, Message)

      • unsubscribe

        public void unsubscribe​(Agent a)
        Removes an agent from the subscriber list for this topic.

        After unsubscribing, the agent will no longer receive messages published to this topic. If the agent was not subscribed, this method has no effect.

        Thread Safety: This method is safe to call concurrently with other subscription operations and message publishing.

        Parameters:
        a - the agent to unsubscribe from this topic
        See Also:
        subscribe(Agent)

      • publish

        public void publish​(Message m)
        Publishes a message to all subscribers of this topic.

        This method implements the core publish operation of the publish-subscribe pattern:

        1. Stores the message as the last published message
        2. Notifies all current subscribers by calling their callback method

        The message is delivered to subscribers by invoking Agent.callback(String, Message) with this topic's name and the message.

        Thread Safety: This method is safe to call concurrently. The CopyOnWriteArrayList ensures that iteration over subscribers is safe even if other threads are modifying the subscriber list during publication.

        Message Persistence: The published message becomes the "last message" and can be retrieved later via getLastMessage().

        Parameters:
        m - the message to publish to all subscribers
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the message is null
        See Also:
        subscribe(Agent), getLastMessage(), Agent.callback(String, Message)

      • addPublisher

        public void addPublisher​(Agent a)
        Registers an agent as a publisher for this topic.

        This method maintains a list of agents that are known to publish messages to this topic. While not required for the publish operation itself, this information is useful for graph visualization and debugging purposes.

        If the agent is already registered as a publisher, this method has no effect.

        Thread Safety: This method is safe to call concurrently with other publisher operations and message publishing.

        Parameters:
        a - the agent to register as a publisher
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the agent is null
        See Also:
        removePublisher(Agent), getPublishers()

      • removePublisher

        public void removePublisher​(Agent a)
        Removes an agent from the publisher list for this topic.

        This method removes the agent from the list of known publishers. If the agent was not registered as a publisher, this method has no effect.

        Thread Safety: This method is safe to call concurrently with other publisher operations and message publishing.

        Parameters:
        a - the agent to remove from the publisher list
        See Also:
        addPublisher(Agent), getPublishers()

      • getSubscribers

        public java.util.List<Agent> getSubscribers()
        Returns a list of all agents currently subscribed to this topic.

        The returned list is the actual internal list used by the topic. Since it's a CopyOnWriteArrayList, it's safe for concurrent iteration but modifications should be done through the topic's methods.

        Returns:
        the list of subscriber agents
        See Also:
        subscribe(Agent), unsubscribe(Agent)

      • getPublishers

        public java.util.List<Agent> getPublishers()
        Returns a list of all agents registered as publishers for this topic.

        The returned list is the actual internal list used by the topic. Since it's a CopyOnWriteArrayList, it's safe for concurrent iteration but modifications should be done through the topic's methods.

        Returns:
        the list of publisher agents
        See Also:
        addPublisher(Agent), removePublisher(Agent)

      • getLastMessage

        public Message getLastMessage()
        Returns the last message published to this topic.

        This method provides access to the most recently published message, which is useful for displaying current topic values or for agents that need to access the current state without subscribing to future updates.

        Returns:
        the last published message, or null if no message has been published yet
        See Also:
        publish(Message), getLastValue()

      • getLastValue

        public java.lang.String getLastValue()
        Returns the text representation of the last published message.

        This is a convenience method that extracts the text value from the last published message. If no message has been published, returns "N/A".

        Returns:
        the text value of the last message, or "N/A" if no message exists
        See Also:
        getLastMessage(), Message.asText

      • clearValue

        public void clearValue()
        Clears the stored last message for this topic.

        After calling this method, getLastMessage() will return null and getLastValue() will return "N/A" until a new message is published.

        This method does not affect the subscriber or publisher lists.

        See Also:
        clearAll(), getLastMessage()

      • clearAll

        public void clearAll()
        Clears all data associated with this topic.

        This method performs a complete reset of the topic:

        • Clears the last message
        • Removes all subscribers
        • Removes all publishers

        After calling this method, the topic will be in the same state as when it was first created.

        Thread Safety: This method is safe to call concurrently, but may cause concurrent publish operations to deliver messages to an empty subscriber list.

        See Also:
        clearValue()
